fluff.name: Sorcerer
entries: Golden eyes flashing, a human stretches out her hand and unleashes the dragonfire that burns in her veins. As an inferno rages around her foes, leathery wings spread from her back and she takes to the air.

Long hair whipped by a conjured wind, a half-elf spreads his arms wide and throws his head back. Lifting him momentarily off the ground, a wave of magic surges up in him, through him, and out from him in a mighty blast of lightning.

Crouching behind a stalagmite, a halfling points a finger at a charging troglodyte. A blast of fire springs from her finger to strike the creature. She ducks back behind the rock formation with a grin, unaware that her wild magic has turned her skin bright blue.

Sorcerers carry a magical birthright conferred upon them by an exotic bloodline, some otherworldly influence, or exposure to unknown cosmic forces. One can't study sorcery as one learns a language, any more than one can learn to live a legendary life. No one chooses sorcery; the power chooses the sorcerer.

entries.name: Raw Magic
entries: Magic is a part of every sorcerer, suffusing body, mind, and spirit with a latent power that waits to be tapped. Some sorcerers wield magic that springs from an ancient bloodline infused with the magic of dragons. Others carry a raw, uncontrolled magic within them, a chaotic storm that manifests in unexpected ways.

The appearance of sorcerous powers is wildly unpredictable. Some draconic bloodlines produce exactly one sorcerer in every generation, but in other lines of descent every individual is a sorcerer. Most of the time, the talents of sorcery appear as apparent flukes. Some sorcerers can't name the origin of their power, while others trace it to strange events in their own lives. The touch of a demon, the blessing of a dryad at a baby's birth, or a taste of the water from a mysterious spring might spark the gift of sorcery. So too might the gift of a deity of magic, exposure to the elemental forces of the Inner Planes or the maddening chaos of Limbo, or a glimpse into the inner workings of reality.

Sorcerers have no use for the spellbooks and ancient tomes of magic lore that wizards rely on, nor do they rely on a patron to grant their spells as warlocks do. By learning to harness and channel their own inborn magic, they can discover new and staggering ways to unleash that power.

entries.name: Unexplained Powers
entries: Sorcerers are rare in the world, and it's unusual to find a sorcerer who is not involved in the adventuring life in some way. People with magical power seething in their veins soon discover that the power doesn't like to stay quiet. A sorcerer's magic wants to be wielded, and it has a tendency to spill out in unpredictable ways if it isn't called on.

Sorcerers often have obscure or quixotic motivations driving them to adventure. Some seek a greater understanding of the magical force that infuses them, or the answer to the mystery of its origin. Others hope to find a way to get rid of it, or to unleash its full potential. Whatever their goals, sorcerers are every bit as useful to an adventuring party as wizards, making up for a comparative lack of breadth in their magical knowledge with enormous flexibility in using the spells they know.

entries.name: Creating a Sorcerer
entries: The most important question to consider when creating your sorcerer is the origin of your power. As a starting character, you'll choose an origin that ties to a draconic bloodline or the influence of wild magic, but the exact source of your power is up to you to decide. Is it a family curse, passed down to you from distant ancestors? Or did some extraordinary event leave you blessed with inherent magic but perhaps scarred as well?

How do you feel about the magical power coursing through you? Do you embrace it, try to master it, or revel in its unpredictable nature? Is it a blessing or a curse? Did you seek it out, or did it find you? Did you have the option to refuse it, and do you wish you had? What do you intend to do with it? Perhaps you feel like you've been given this power for some lofty purpose. Or you might decide that the power gives you the right to do what you want, to take what you want from those who lack such power. Perhaps your power links you to a powerful individual in the world—the fey creature that blessed you at birth, the dragon who put a drop of its blood into your veins, the lich who created you as an experiment, or the deity who chose you to carry this power.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a sorcerer quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the hermit background. Third, choose the {@spell 光亮术}, {@spell 魔法技俩}, {@spell 冷冻射线}, and {@spell 电爪} cantrips, along with the 1st-level spells {@spell 护盾术} and {@spell 魔法飞弹}.
Practice and study are for amateurs. True power is a birthright.

When it comes to drawing forth their abilities in times of need, sorcerers have it easy compared to other characters. Their power not only rests within them, but it likely takes some effort to keep it at bay. Every sorcerer is born to the role, or stumbles into it through cosmic chance. Unlike other characters, who must actively learn, embrace, and pursue their talents, sorcerers have their power thrust upon them.

Because the idea of an innately magical being traveling among them does not sit well with many folk, sorcerers tend to breed mistrust and suspicion in others they come across. Nonetheless, many sorcerers succeed in overcoming that prejudice through deeds that benefit their less magically gifted contemporaries.

Sorcerers are often defined by the events surrounding the manifestation of their power. For those who receive it as an expected birthright, its appearance is a cause for celebration. Other sorcerers are treated as outcasts, banished from their homes after the sudden, terrifying arrival of their abilities.
Playing a sorcerer character can be as rewarding as it is challenging. The sections below offer suggestions on how to flesh out and personalize your persona.

entries.name: Arcane Origins
entries: Some sorcerers understand where their power came from, based on how their abilities manifested. Others can only speculate, since their powers came to them in a way that suggests no particular cause.

Does your character know the source of your magical power? Does it tie back to some distant relative, a cosmic event, or blind chance? If your sorcerer doesn't know where their power arose from, your DM can use this table (or select an origin) and reveal it to you when the information plays a role in the campaign.

entries.caption: Arcane Origins
rows: Your power arises from your family's bloodline. You are related to some powerful creature, or you inherited a blessing or a curse.
You are the reincarnation of a being from another plane of existence.
A powerful entity entered the world. Its magic changed you.
Your birth was prophesied in an ancient text, and you are foretold to use your power for terrible ends.
You are the product of generations of careful, selective breeding.
You were made in a vat by an alchemist.

entries.name: Reaction
entries: When a new sorcerer enters the world, either at birth or later when one's power becomes evident, the consequences of that event depend greatly on how its witnesses react to what they have seen.
When your sorcerer's powers appeared, how did the world around you respond? Were other people supportive, fearful, or somewhere in between?

entries.caption: Reactions
rows: Your powers are seen as a great blessing by those around you, and you are expected to use them in service to your community.
Your powers caused destruction and even a death when they became evident, and you were treated as a criminal.
Your neighbors hate and fear your power, causing them to shun you.
You came to the attention of a sinister cult that plans on exploiting your abilities.
People around you believe that your powers are a curse levied on your family for a past transgression.
Your powers are believed to be tied to an ancient line of mad kings that supposedly ended in a bloody revolt over a century ago.

entries.name: Supernatural Mark
entries: A sorcerer at rest is almost indistinguishable from a normal person; it's only when their magic flies forth that sorcerers reveal their true nature. Even so, many sorcerers have a subtle but telling physical trait that sets them apart from other folk.
If your sorcerer has a supernatural mark, it might be one that's easily concealed, or it could be a source of pride that you keep on constant display.

entries.caption: Supernatural Marks
rows: Your eyes are an unusual color, such as red.
You have an extra toe on one foot.
One of your ears is noticeably larger than the other.
Your hair grows at a prodigious rate.
You wrinkle your nose repeatedly while you are chewing.
A red splotch appears on your neck once a day, then vanishes after an hour.

entries.name: Signs of Sorcery
entries: As the world well knows, some sorcerers are better than others at controlling their spellcasting. Sometimes a wild display of magic gone awry emanates from a sorcerer who casts a spell. But even when one's magic goes off as planned, the act of casting is often accompanied by a telltale sign that makes it clear where that magical energy came from.

When your sorcerer character casts a spell, does the effort reveal itself in a sign of sorcery? Is this sign tied to your origin or some other aspect of who you are, or is it a seemingly random phenomenon?

entries.caption: Signs of Sorcery
rows: You deliver the verbal components of your spells in the booming voice of a titan.
For a moment after you cast a spell, the area around you grows dark and gloomy.
You sweat profusely while casting a spell and for a few seconds thereafter.
Your hair and garments are briefly buffeted about, as if by a breeze, whenever you call forth a spell.
If you are standing when you cast a spell, you rise six inches into the air and gently float back down.
Illusory blue flames wreathe your head as you begin your casting, then abruptly disappear.

classFeature.name: 术法起源
entries: 从可选的起源列表中选择一个术法起源，它代表着你天生魔法力量的来源。
你的选择会在1级、6级、14级、和18级的时候赋予你新的能力。

classFeature.name: Spell Versatility
entries: {@i 1st-level sorcerer feature (enhances Spellcasting)}

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can replace one spell you learned from this Spellcasting feature with another spell from the sorcerer spell list. The new spell must be the same level as the spell you replace.

classFeature.name: 施法
entries: 过去的一个事件、或者你双亲或先祖的血脉，在你身上留下了不可磨灭的印记，使你充满了奥秘魔法。不论其起源如何，这种魔法泉源驱动着你的法术。请参阅{@book 第十章|PHB|10}以了解关于施法的规则，以及第十一章以查阅{@filter 术士法术列表|spells|class=sorcerer}。

entries.name: 戏法
entries: 在1级时，你知晓四个从{@filter 术士法术列表|spells|class=sorcerer}自选的戏法。你将在升至更高的术士等级时学会额外的术士戏法：在4级的时候学会第5个戏法，在10级的时候学会第6个。

entries.name: 法术位
entries: 术士表中显示了你有多少个法术位可以用来施放你一环或更高环的{@filter 术士法术|spells|class=sorcerer}。要施放其中一个术士法术，你必须消耗一个与该法术环阶相同或更高的法术位。你在完成一次长休后恢复所有你花费掉的法术位。
举例来说，如果你知晓一个1环的{@spell 燃烧之手}法术，且你拥有一个1环和一个2环的法术位，则你可以使用其中任意一个法术位来施放{@spell 燃烧之手}。

entries.name: 一环或更高环的已知法术
entries: 你知晓二个从术士法术列表中自选的1环法术。
你将在提升至在每个除了第12,14,16,18,19,和20级的术士等级时，习得一个新的术士法术。每个这些法术的环阶都必须符合你所拥有法术位的环阶。举例来说，当你在此职业升至3级时，你可以学习一个新的1环或2环法术。
此外，当你提升这个职业的等级时，你可以从术士的法术列表中挑选一个法术来取代一个你目前已知的法术，而它的环阶也必须符合你所拥有法术位的环阶。

entries.name: 施法属性
entries: 因为你魔法的力量依赖于你将自己的意志投射于世界的能力，魅力是你施展术士法术的施法属性。每当法术提及你的施法属性时，你将使用你的魅力。此外，当决定你术士法术的豁免DC、以及使用术士法术进行攻击检定时，你使用你的魅力调整值。

entries.name: 施法法器
entries: 你可以使用一个{@item 奥术法器|phb}（第五章），来作为你施放术士法术的法器。

classFeature.name: 易变施法
entries: 你可以使用你的术法点以获得额外的法术位，或牺牲法术位以获得额外的术法点。随着你升至更高的等级，你将学会其他使用你术法点的方式。

entries.name: 创造法术位
entries: 你可以在你的回合以一个附赠动作将尚未消耗的术法点转变成一个法术位。被创造出来的法术位将在长休结束时消失。创造法术位表中显示了创造各环阶的法术位所需要消耗的术法点。你可以创造出不超过5环的法术位。

classFeature.name: 魔力泉涌

entries.name: 术法点
entries: 你拥有2点术法点，且你每提升一级就能再额外获得一点，并在20级时达到最大值20点。你所拥有的术法点永远无法超过表格中对应你当前等级的数值。你在完成一次长休后恢复所有你花费掉的术法点。

如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

entries: {@i 4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

entries: As an action, you can spend any number of sorcery points to roll a {@dice d4} for each point expended. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the total rolled.

你获得从你背后长出一对龙翼的能力，获得等同于你当下速度的飞行速度。你可以在你的回合以一个附赠动作创造这对龙翼。它们会持续直到你在你的回合以一个附赠动作解消它们。
你无法在你穿戴护甲时操作这对龙翼，除非该护甲是为了容纳它们而被打造。此外，未被设计于容纳你龙翼的服装将在你操作龙翼的时候被破坏。

subclassFeature.name: 真龙威仪
entries: {@i 18级龙族血脉特性}

你可以引导来自你龙族血统的骇人威仪，使你周遭的人们因而被震撼或{@condition 恐惧}。以一个动作，你可以消耗5点术法点以汲取这种力量，并散发出一道距离60尺范围，令人敬畏或恐惧的灵光（由你选择）。持续1分钟或直到你失去你的专注（如同你施放一个专注法术），每个在这道灵光中开始它回合的敌意生物必须成功通过一次感知豁免，否则在这道灵光结束前被{@condition 魅惑}（若你选择敬畏效果）或{@condition 恐惧}（若你选择恐惧效果）。一个成功通过此豁免检定的生物将在接下来的24小时内免疫你的灵光。

subclassFeature.name: 狂野魔法
entries: 你的天生魔法来自于潜伏于创造秩序之下的狂野混沌之力。你也许曾暴露于某种形式的原初魔力之下，也许穿越了一扇位面传送门到混沌海、元素位面、或者神秘的遥远国度。也许你曾被一个强大的精类生物祝福、或被一名恶魔所标记。又或者你的魔法仅仅是你诞生时侥幸获得，并没有显著的原因或理由。无论其来源为何，这道混乱魔力在你体内翻涌着，等待着被以任何方式释放出来。

subclassFeature.name: 混乱之潮
entries: {@i 1级狂野魔法特性}
你可以操作几率和混乱之力以在一次攻击检定、属性检定、或豁免检定中获得优势。一旦你这么做，你必须在完成一次长休后才能再使用此能力。
在你重新获得使用混乱之潮的能力之前，DM可以紧接你施放一个1环或更高环的术士法术后要求你掷骰使用狂野魔法浪涌表。接着你恢复使用混乱之潮的能力。

subclassFeature.name: 狂野魔法浪涌
entries: {@i 1级狂野魔法特性}
你的施法可以释放出未经驯服的魔法浪涌。紧接在你施放一个1环或更高环的术士法术，DM可以要求你骰一颗{@dice d20}。若你骰出了1，则掷骰使用狂野魔法浪涌表以创造出一个随机的魔法效果。一道狂野魔法浪涌在每回合可以发生一次。
若狂野魔法效果为一个法术，则它太过狂野以至于它无法被超魔法影响。若它原本需要专注，则它在这个情况下也不需要专注；该法术将持续到它的完整持续时间。

entries.caption: 狂野魔法浪涌
rows: 在接下来一分钟内，你在你的每个回合开始时骰这张表，并在后续的掷骰中无视骰到这个项目的掷骰结果。
在接下来一分钟内，若任何{@condition 隐形}生物处于你的视线范围内，则你可以看见它。
一个DM所选择并控制的魔冢出现在距离你5尺内的一处未被占据空间，并在1分钟后消失。
你以3环法术，以你自己为中心施放{@spell 火球术}。
你以5环法术施放{@spell 魔法飞弹}。
骰一颗{@dice d10}。你的身高改变等同于掷骰结果的寸数。若掷骰结果为奇数，你的身高变矮。若掷骰结果为偶数，你的身高变高。
你以自己为中心施放{@spell 困惑术}。
在接下来一分钟内，你在你的每个回合开始时回复5点生命值。
你的脸上长出大把羽毛组成的长须。一旦你打了喷嚏，这些羽毛将从你脸上被炸飞出去。
你以自己为中心施放{@spell 油腻术}。
所有生物在对抗你在接下来一分钟内所施放的下一个涉及豁免检定的法术时，所进行的豁免检定具有劣势。
你的肌肤变成有着鲜艳渐层的蓝色。一个{@spell 移除诅咒}法术可以终止此效果。
一颗眼睛将在接下来一分钟内出现在你的额头上。
在接下来一分钟内，你所有施法时间为1个动作的法术，其施法时间变成1个附赠动作。
你传送最远60尺距离到一处你所选且你能看见的一处未被占据空间。
你被传送到星界直到你的下个回合结束，在那之后你将回到你先前所占据的空间，或若该空间被占据，则回到离该处最近的一处未被占据空间。
在接下来一分钟内你所施放的下一个伤害法术的伤害取最大值。
骰一颗{@dice d10}。你的年龄改变等同于掷骰结果的年数。若掷骰结果为奇数，你变年轻（最小一岁）。若掷骰结果为偶数，你变得更老。
{@dice 1d6}个由DM控制的{@creature 呋噜|MM}出现在距离你60尺内的未被占据空间，且对你感到{@condition 恐惧}。它们将在1分钟后消失。
你回复{@dice 2d10}点生命值。
你变成一个盆栽植物直到你的下个回合开始。当变成盆栽植物时，你处于{@condition 无力}状态且对所有伤害易伤。若你的生命值归零，你的盆栽将被破坏，且你恢复原本的型态。
在接下来一分钟内，你可以在你的每个回合以一个附赠动作传送最远20尺距离。
你对你自己施放{@spell 浮空术}。
一个由DM控制的{@creature 独角兽}出现在距离你5尺内的一个空间，并在1分钟后消失。
你在接下来一分钟内无法说话。每当你尝试说话时，粉红色的泡泡将从你口中飘出。
一道灵体似的护盾在接下来一分钟内漂浮于你附近，使你的AC获得+2加值，并让你免疫于{@spell 魔法飞弹}。
你在接下来的{@dice 5d6}天内免疫于酒精导致的酒醉状态。
你的头发掉光，但在24小时内重新长回来。
在接下来一分钟内，任何你所碰触，且未被其他生物穿戴或携带的可燃物体都将熊熊燃烧。
你恢复你花费掉最低环阶的法术位。
在接下来一分钟内，你在说话时必须用吼的。
你以你自己为中心施放{@spell 云雾术}。
最多三个你所选择距离你30尺内的生物受到{@dice 4d10}闪电伤害。
你因离你最近的生物而陷入{@condition 恐惧}状态，持续直到你的下个回合结束。
每个距离你30尺内的生物在接下来一分钟内变得{@condition 隐形}。作用于一个生物的隐形状态会在它攻击或施放法术时结束。
你在接下来一分钟内获得对所有伤害的抗性。
一个距离你60尺内的随机生物将陷入{@condition 中毒}状态长达{@dice 1d4}小时。
你在接下来一分钟内发出30尺半径的明亮光照。任何在距离你5尺内结束它回合的生物将陷入{@condition 目盲}状态直到它的下个回合结束。
你对你自己施放{@spell 变形术}。若你在该豁免检定中失败，你将在法术的持续时间内被变成一只绵羊。
幻影蝴蝶和花瓣在接下来一分钟内于你10尺内翩翩飞舞于空中。
你可以立刻采取一个额外的动作。
每个距离你30尺内的生物受到{@dice 1d10}黯蚀伤害。你回复等同于所造成黯蚀伤害总和的生命值。
你施放{@spell 镜影术}。
你对一个距离你60尺内的随机生物施放{@spell 飞行术}。
你在接下来一分钟内变得{@condition 隐形}。在这段时间内，其他生物无法听见你。这个隐形状态会在你攻击或施放法术时结束。
若你在接下来一分钟内死亡，你将立刻复活，如同被施放了{@spell 转生术}法术。
你的体型在接下来一分钟内增加一级。
你和所有距离你30尺内的生物在接下来一分钟内获得对穿刺伤害的易伤。
你在接下来一分钟内被模糊缥缈的音乐环绕。
你恢复所有你花费掉的术法点。

subclassFeature.name: 窜改运气
entries: {@i 6级狂野魔法特性}
你拥有通过你狂野魔法来扭曲命运的能力。当另一个你所能看见的生物进行一次攻击检定、属性检定、或豁免检定时，你可以使用你的反应并消耗2点术法点，骰{@dice 1d4}并将掷骰结果作为加值或减值（由你决定）加入该生物的检定结果。你可以在该生物掷骰后，但在任何该检定的效果生效之前这么做。

subclassFeature.name: 控制混沌
entries: {@i 14级狂野魔法特性}
你获得了对于你狂野魔法浪涌的些微控制。每当你掷骰使用狂野魔法浪涌表时，你可以重骰二次并使用其中一个掷骰结果。

subclassFeature.name: 法术轰击
entries: {@i 18级狂野魔法特性}
你法术的伤害性能量明显加剧。当你会一个法术掷骰决定伤害，且其中任何一颗骰子骰出了最大的骰面，则从这些骰子中选择一颗，重骰它并将其掷骰结果加到伤害中。你在每个回合只能使用此能力一次。

subclassFeature.name: Pyromancer (PSK)
entries: Your innate magic manifests in fire. You are your fire, and your fire is you.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Fire
entries: At 1st level, whenever you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, fiery magic erupts from you. This eruption causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you to take fire damage equal to half your sorcerer level (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Fire in the Veins
entries: At 6th level, you gain resistance to fire damage. In addition, spells you cast ignore resistance to fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Pyromancer's Fury
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal fire damage to the attacker. The damage equals your sorcerer level, and ignores resistance to fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fiery Soul
entries: At 18th level, you gain immunity to fire damage. In addition, any spell or effect you create ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance to fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: 畸变心智
entries: 某种外来的影响曾经用它的卷须将你的意识缠绕裹拢，给予了你灵能之力。如今，你能够使用这股力量触碰他人的内心，或是用它操控多元宇宙的魔法能量颠复你周遭的世界。这种力量会从你身上如希望的灯塔一般照耀着旁人吗？抑或是使你成为恐惧之源，使他人得见你怪异的力量，受你的心灵所伤害呢？
作为一名畸变心智术士，你能决定如何获得你的能力。这是你与生俱来的吗？还是后来发生的某件事使你展现出卓越的灵能？参考异常起源表以了解你可能的力量来源。

entries.caption: 畸变起源
rows: 你曾暴露在遥远国度扭曲的影响之下。你坚信着有触须在你身上生长，但其他人都看不到。
一阵来自星界的灵能之风将心灵异能灌入你的体内。现在，当你使用这股力量时，你的身边会有微弱的光点闪烁。
你曾受到底栖魔鱼的支配，它的力量在你的脑海中留下了一个精神碎片。
你被植入了一只夺心魔蝌蚪，但蜕变一直没能完成。现在，其灵能力已经被你占为已有。当你使用灵能时，你的身体里会冒出奇怪的粘液。
小时候，你有一个想象中的朋友，它看上去像是呋噜或是一只奇怪的鸭嘴兽形生物。某天，它赠与你灵能的力量，但它最终不再止步于想象。
你的噩梦向你透露了真相：你的灵能不是来源于自身，而是从你未能成功出世的孪生兄弟/姐妹处抽取来的！

subclassFeature.name: 灵能法术
entries: {@i 1级畸变心智特性}
当你达到相应的术士等级时，你习得下表中的额外法术。这些法术对你而言视为术士法术，且不受术士表上已知法术一栏的数量限制。
每当你提升术士等级时，你可以选择一个环数相同的新法术来替换你因此特性习得的一个法术。该法术必须为{@filter 术士、契术师或法师法术列表中的一个预言系或惑控系法术|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=D;E|level=1;2;3;4;5}。

entries.caption: 灵能法术
rows: 1st
{@spell 哈达之臂}, {@spell 噪音暗语}, {@spell 心灵之楔|tce}
3rd
{@spell 安定心神}, {@spell 侦测思想}
5th
{@spell 哈达之欲}, {@spell 短讯术}
7th
{@spell 艾伐黑触手}, {@spell 异怪召唤术|TCE}
9th
{@spell 拉瑞心灵联结}, {@spell 心灵遥控}

subclassFeature.name: 传心谈话
entries: {@i 1级畸变心智特性}
1级起，你能够在自己与他人的意识中构建一道心灵感应的链接。以一个附赠动作，你可以选择30尺内一个你可见的生物，只要你与其距离的里数不超过你的魅力调整值（至少1里），你与其能够通过心灵感应方式进行交流。你们必须使用对方知晓的语言进行心灵交流才能使其理解你通过心灵感应传达的话语。
心灵感应的链接持续等同于你术士等级的分钟数。当你{@condition 无力}或死亡，或你使用此能力与其他生物构建链接时，其提前结束。

subclassFeature.name: 灵能术法
entries: {@i 6级畸变心智特性}
6级起，当你施放一个你通过灵能法术特性知晓的法术时，你可以改为使用等同于该法术环数数量的术法点而非消耗法术位施放该法术。你依然可以用法术位正常施放这些法术。
当你通过此能力施放法术时，你无视该法术施法需要的语言成分或姿势成分。你同时无视该法术需要的不会消耗的材料成分。

subclassFeature.name: 心灵防御
entries: {@i 6级畸变心智特性}
6级起，你对心灵伤害获得抗力。此外，你在对抗{@condition 魅惑}或{@condition 恐惧}的豁免检定上获得优势。

subclassFeature.name: 血肉启示
entries: {@i 14级畸变心智特性}
14级起，你能够释放出潜藏在你内部扭曲的真实形态。以一个附赠动作，你使用至少1术法点以魔法性地转变形态，持续10分钟。你每因此使用了1术法点，你便可以在转变形态期间选择并获得以下一种增益：

items: 你能看见60尺内的{@condition 隐形}生物，前提是其对你不为全遮蔽。
你获得等同于你行走速度的飞行速度，并能停留在空中。当你飞行时，你的皮肤表面流出发光的粘液或是散发出超凡脱俗的光芒。
你获得等同于你两倍行走速度的游泳速度，且你能在水下呼吸。此外，腮从你的脖子上长出来，或从耳后呈扇状翻出，你的手指变成蹼趾，或有卷曲的细毛从你的衣服底下翻腾而出。
你的身体和你携带的装备都变得柔韧粘滑。你能够轻松穿过最窄1寸宽的狭窄空间而不用挤进去，且你可以消耗5尺移动速度以逃离非魔法的{@condition 束缚}或{@condition 被擒}。

subclassFeature.name: 扭曲爆裂
entries: {@i 18级畸变心智特性}
18级起，你能够解放你异质的力量，从而制造扭曲空间的异常现象。以一个动作，你可以传送到120尺内你可见的一个未被占据的位置，然后你消失位置30尺内的生物必须进行一次力量豁免，失败受{@damage 3d10}力场伤害并被立即拉向你原本的位置或最近的一个未被占据的位置，成功半伤且不受拉扯。
一旦你使用了此能力，你在完成一次长休息之前必须消耗5术法点以再次使用此能力。

subclassFeature.name: 时械之魂
entries: 一股力量，一股源自宇宙本身的秩序力量，从机械境————或其他类似的位面之中产生，并扩散到你的灵魂之中，使你充满了魔力。你或你宗族中的某个人也许已经卷入到魔冢这种居住在机械境的秩序生命的阴谋之中。又或许，你的先祖甚至参与过魔冢长征。无论是何种起源，秩序的力量也许对旁人来说有些奇怪，但于你而言，它是一个宏伟而璀璨的系统的一部分。

subclassFeature.name: 时械法术
entries: {@i 1级时械之魂特性}
当你达到相应的术士等级时，你习得下表中的额外法术。这些法术对你而言视为术士法术，且不受术士表上已知法术一栏的数量限制。
每当你提升术士等级时，你可以选择一个环数相同的新法术来替换你因此特性习得的一个法术。该法术必须为{@filter 术士、契术师或法师法术列表中的一个防护系或变化系法术|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=A;T|level=1;2;3;4;5}。

entries.caption: 时械法术
rows: 1st
{@spell 警报术}, {@spell 防护善恶}
3rd
{@spell 援助术}, {@spell 次级复原术}
5th
{@spell 解除魔法}, {@spell 防护能量}
7th
{@spell 行动自如术}, {@spell 构装体召唤术|TCE}
9th
{@spell 高等复原术}, {@spell 力墙术}

entries: 此外，你可以从秩序显迹表格中选择或掷骰决定一种你在施法时显现出与秩序之联系的方式。

entries.caption: 秩序显迹
rows: 幽灵般的虚幻齿轮在你身后旋转。
时钟的指针出现在你的眼中。
你的皮肤发出如黄铜般的金属光泽。
你的体表浮动着方程式和几何图形。
你的法器短暂地变化成小巧的机械装置。
你和那些受到你法术影响的生物都会听到齿轮的滴答声或是钟表的响铃。

subclassFeature.name: 归复平衡
entries: {@i 1级时械之魂特性}
1级起，你与绝对秩序之位面的联系使你能重整混沌的时刻。当你60尺内一个你可见的生物即将进行一次具有优势或劣势的{@dice d20}检定时，你可以用反应使其免受优势或劣势的影响。
你可以使用此能力的次数等同于你的熟练加值。每当你完成一次长休息，你重新获得已消耗的使用次数。

subclassFeature.name: 律令之壁
entries: {@i 6级时械之魂特性}
6级起，你可以利用事物的壮丽联系为一个生物激发闪烁的秩序之盾。以一个动作，你可以使用1至5术法点创造出一个环绕你或30尺内一个你可见的生物的魔法屏障。此屏障持续存在直到你完成一次长休息或直至你再次使用此能力。
屏障具有等同于你所消耗术法点数量的{@dice d8}骰。当被守护的生物受到伤害时，其可以消耗任意数量的这些d8骰，并使该伤害减少掷出结果的数值。

subclassFeature.name: 序列意识
entries: {@i 14级时械之魂特性}
14级起，你获得了将你的意识和机械境无尽的计算达成同步的能力。以一个附赠动作，你可以在1分钟内进入此种状态。在此期间，对你进行的攻击免受优势的影响，且每当你进行一次攻击检定、属性检定或豁免检定时，你可以将{@dice d20}掷出的9或以下的数值视为10。
一旦你使用了此能力，你在完成一次长休息之前必须消耗5术法点以再次使用此能力。

subclassFeature.name: 时械矩阵
entries: {@i 18级时械之魂特性}
18级起，你召唤出秩序的精魂以抹除周遭的混乱。以一个动作，你在以你为中心30尺立方空间的范围内召唤出精魂。这些精魂看起来像是魔冢或你选择的其他构装体，没有实体也不能摧毁，并在消失前使立方范围内产生以下效应：

items: 精魂合计提供至多回复100生命值，由你随意分配给范围内任意数量的生物。
范围内受到伤害的物件被立即修复。
你选择范围内任意数量的生物或物件，其承受的任何6环或以下的法术结束。

entries: 一旦你使用了此能力，你在完成一次长休息之前必须消耗7术法点以再次使用此能力。

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Soul
entries: One day a light blazed forth within you—the illumination of psionic power. Your mind now simmers with this power, the full extent of which you won't fully grasp for years to come. You can touch other minds with it and alter the world around you by using it to control the magical energy of the multiverse. Will this power shine from you as a hopeful beacon to others? Or will you be a source of terror to those who feel the stab of your mind and witness the strange manifestations of your might?

Among githyanki and githzerai, the powers of Psionic Soul sorcerers are revered and marshaled on both sides of the gith war. In Eberron, many kalashtar dream of discovering this origin's abilities within themselves, and in Athas, more sorcerers are born with a Psionic Soul than with any other source of power. In the glades of primeval woods touched by the Feywild, children sometimes awaken to the wonders of psionic power. And in communities that survive Far Realm incursions, some folk are mutated into horrific aberrations, while a lucky few not only remain themselves, but also discover that psionic energy now suffuses their minds.

As a Psionic Soul sorcerer, you decide how you acquired your powers. Were you born with them, and did they manifest throughout childhood? Or did an extraordinary event later in life leave you shining with psionic awareness? Consult the Psionic Origins table for a possible origin of your power.

entries.caption: Psionic Origins
rows: You were exposed to the Far Realm's warping influence. You can now use your mind in ways you never thought possible, and you're also convinced that a tendril is growing upon you.
A psychic wind from the Astral Plane carried psionic energy into your being. When you use your powers now, faint motes of light sparkle around you.
You or your ancestor were trained by a githzerai monk to unlock the psionic potential within yourself.
A spirit haunts your mind, lending incredible power to your thoughts. When you sleep, the spirit's memories invade your dreams.

Deep in a forest touched by the Feywild, you drank from a glimmering stream, and now your mind shines with power. Beasts and fey creatures are often now friendly to you, as if they can sense the light within you.
Upon recovering from a near-fatal injury, you found yourself with psionic powers. Whenever you use them, your old wound tingles.
You were implanted with a mind flayer tadpole, but the ceremorphosis never completed. And now the psionic power is yours. When you use it, your flesh shines with a strange mucus.
As a child, you had an imaginary friend that looked like a flumph or a strange platypuslike creature. One day, it gifted you with psionic powers, which have ended up being not so imaginary.
Your nightmares whisper the truth to you: your psionic powers are not your own. You draw them from your vestigial twin!
You grew up near the lair of a sapphire dragon, and now your eyes glow with sapphire light when you use your newfound powers.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Talent
entries: {@i 1st-level Psionic Soul feature}

You harbor a wellspring of psionic power within yourself, an energy that ebbs and flows as you channel it in various ways. This power is represented by your Psionic Talent die, the starting size of which is a {@dice d6}.

entries.name: Psionic Talent Options
entries: You can use your Psionic Talent die in the following ways:

items.name: Psionic Discovery.
items.entry: You can unlock the ability to cast a mind-oriented sorcerer spell you don't already know. After meditating for 10 minutes (which can be done during a rest), roll your Psionic Talent die, and choose a sorcerer spell of a level for which you have spell slots and that is in the school of divination or enchantment. You know the chosen spell for a number of hours equal to the number you rolled.

items.name: Psychic Sorcery.
items.entry: When you cast a spell, you can use your mind to form it, rather than relying on words, gestures, and materials. To do so, roll your Psionic Talent die. The spell then requires no verbal component, and if you rolled the level of the spell or higher, the spell doesn't require somatic or material components either.

items.name: Telepathic Speech.
items.entry: You can form a telepathic connection between your mind and the mind of another. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see, and roll your Psionic Talent die. For a number of hours equal to the number you rolled, you and the chosen creature can speak telepathically with each other while the two of you are within a number of miles of each other equal to the number you rolled. To understand each other, you each must speak mentally in a language the other knows. The telepathic connection ends early if you use this ability to form a connection with a different creature.

entries.name: Changing the Die's Size
entries: If you roll the highest number on your Psionic Talent die, it decreases by one die size after the roll. This represents you burning through your psionic energy. For example, if the die is a {@dice d6} and you roll a 6, it becomes a {@dice d4}. If it's a {@dice d4} and you roll a 4, it becomes unusable until you finish a long rest.

Conversely, if you roll a 1 on your Psionic Talent die, it increases by one die size after the roll, up to its starting size. This represents you conserving psionic energy for later use. For example, if you roll a 1 on a {@dice d4}, the die then becomes a {@dice d6}.

Whenever you finish a long rest, your Psionic Talent die resets to its starting size. When you reach certain levels in this class, the starting size of your Psionic Talent die increases: at 5th level ({@dice d8}), 11th level ({@dice d10}), and 17th level ({@dice d12}).

entries.name: Psi Replenishment
entries: As a bonus action, you can calm your mind for a moment and restore your Psionic Talent die to its starting size. You then can't use Psi Replenishment again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Strike
entries: {@i 6th-level Psionic Soul feature}

You have learned to channel additional psychic energy into your spells. Immediately after you deal damage to a creature with a sorcerer spell for which you expend a spell slot, you can roll your Psionic Talent die and also deal psychic damage to that creature equal to the number rolled. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Over Body
entries: {@i 14th-level Psionic Soul feature}

You can now use the psi that flows through you to give your body extraordinary abilities. As a bonus action, you can roll your Psionic Talent die and spend 1 or more sorcery points to magically transform yourself for a number of hours equal to the number rolled. Until the transformation ends, you gain one of the following benefits of your choice for each sorcery point you spent, choosing a different benefit for each point:

items: You can see any {@condition 隐形} creature within 60 feet of you, provided it isn't behind total cover.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and you can hover.
You gain a swimming speed equal to twice your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.

Your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, becomes pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition 被擒}.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Aura
entries: {@i 18th-level Psionic Soul feature}

If your Psionic Talent die is available, you can unleash your psionic power in a crackling aura of psychic energy; as a bonus action, you can magically radiate this transparent, 30-foot-radius aura for 1 minute or until you're {@condition 无力} or lose the use of your Psionic Talent die.

Whenever a creature starts its turn in the aura or moves into it for the first time on a turn, you can roll your Psionic Talent die and deal psychic damage to the creature, equaling the number rolled plus your Charisma modifier. If the creature takes any of this damage, its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Soul
entries: A plane of utmost order, Mechanus is a realm overseen by a godlike entity called Primus, whose actions are inscrutable and calculations, vast. You, or someone from your lineage, might have become entangled in one of the machinations of the leader of the modrons. Perhaps you were exposed to an artifact created by Primus, or your ancestor took part in the Great Modron March in some way.

The power of Mechanus can seem strange and alien to others, but for you it is part of a vast and glorious system that others can't comprehend. At your option, you can pick from or roll on the Manifestations of Mechanus table to create a way your connection to the plane manifests while you are casting a spell.

entries.caption: Manifestations of Mechanus
rows: Large, spectral cogwheels appear hovering behind you.
The hands of a clock appear in your eyes.
Your skin glows with a golden, metallic sheen.
Your features become unnaturally angular, like geometric objects.
Your spellcasting focus takes the form of a miniature Spawning Stone or other creation of Primus.
The ringing of a clock can be heard by you and those affected by your magic.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Magic
entries: {@i 1st-level Clockwork Soul feature}

You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Clockwork Spells table. Each spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These spells can't be replaced when you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Restore Balance
entries: {@i 1st-level Clockwork Soul feature}

Your connection to the plane of absolute order allows you to equalize chaotic moments. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you is about to roll a {@dice d20} with advantage or disadvantage, you can use your reaction to prevent the roll from being affected by advantage and disadvantage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark of Law
entries: {@i 6th-level Clockwork Soul feature}

You can imbue a creature with a shimmering shield of order. As an action, you can expend 1 to 5 sorcery points to create a magical ward around yourself or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The ward lasts until you finish a long rest or until you use this feature again.

The ward is represented by a number of {@dice d8}s equal to the number of sorcery points spent to create it. When the warded creature takes damage, it can use its reaction to spend a number of those dice, roll them, and reduce the damage taken by the total of the spent dice.

subclassFeature.name: Trance of Order
entries: {@i 14th-level Clockwork Soul feature}

You gain the ability to enter a state of clockwork consciousness as a bonus action. For the next minute, attack rolls against you can't benefit from advantage, and whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.
Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest or until you expend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Cavalcade
entries: {@i 18th-level Clockwork Soul feature}

You summon spirits of order to restore balance around you. As an action, you summon the spirits in a 30-foot cube originating from you. The spirits look like modrons or other constructs of your choice. The spirits are intangible and invulnerable, work fast and efficiently, and create the following effects within the cube before vanishing:

items: The spirits restore up to 100 hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures of your choice in the cube.
Any damaged objects entirely in the cube are repaired.
Every spell of 6th level or lower ends on creatures and objects of your choice in the cube.

entries: Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest or until you expend 7 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Giant Soul (UA)
entries: The giants once dwelled in a fabled realm known as Ostoria, a paradise for their folk that reflected their mastery of the mortal realm. In time, Ostoria fell, and the giants were scattered and broken. During that mythic era, the giants granted a few chosen individuals among the small folk a shard of their great power. These favored people were caught in the same tragedy that sundered Ostoria. Since that time, they have spread across the many worlds of the multiverse. Now and again, one of their descendants manifests the gifts imparted by the giants, granting them sorcerous magic that allows them to command the elements and gain the might of a giant.

subclassFeature.name: Jotun Resilience
entries: The resilience of giants flows through your body. At 1st level, your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Mark of the Ordning
entries: At 1st level, you discover innate magical abilities within yourself that are based on your giant heritage. Select one of the giant types from the Mark of the Ordning table. At 1st and 3rd level, you learn the spells associated with your choice, as shown in the table. These spells count as sorcerer spells for you, but they don't count against your number of sorcerer spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Lost Ostoria
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain a benefit whenever you cast one of the spells granted by your Mark of the Ordning Feature.

entries.name: Cloud Giant
entries: Immediately after you cast any of your Mark of the Ordning spells, you can magically teleport as a bonus action. You teleport to an unoccupied space you can see that is no farther away than a number of feet equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Fire Giant
entries: You gain a bonus to the damage rolls of your Mark of the Ordning spells. The bonus equals your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

entries.name: Frost Giant
entries: Immediately after you cast any of your Mark of the Ordning spells, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). But if the spell is {@spell 艾嘉西斯之铠}, you instead increase its temporary hit points by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Hill Giant
entries: Immediately after you cast any of your Mark of the Ordning spells, you can target up to two creatures within 5 feet of you that you can see. Each target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be pushed a number of feet away from you equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1). A target can choose to fail this save.

entries.name: Stone Giant
entries: Immediately after you cast any of your Mark of the Ordning spells, you gain a bonus to AC equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1) until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Storm Giant
entries: Immediately after you cast any of your Mark of the Ordning spells, up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you take lightning damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Rage of Fallen Ostoria
entries: Starting at 14th level, you gain the ability to channel the souls of your ancestors into your physical form. When you start casting a sorcerer spell on your turn and expend a spell slot, you can increase your size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example.
This increase lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you die or are {@condition 无力}. Until it ends, you enjoy the following benefits:

items: Your current hit points and your hit point maximum both increase by 1 per sorcerer level.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.
Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.
You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
You gain a bonus to the damage rolls of your melee weapon attacks; the bonus equals your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the All Father
entries: At 18th level, your Constitution score increases by 2, up to a maximum of 22.

In addition, you can now use Rage of Fallen Ostoria twice between rests, but no more than once on a turn. If you use that feature while under its effects, its increases to your size, hit points, reach, and walking speed are cumulative.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow
entries: Your innate magic comes from the Shadowfell. You might trace your lineage to an entity from that place, or perhaps you were exposed to its fell energy and transformed in some fundamental manner.

The power of shadow magic casts a strange pall over your physical presence. The spark of life that sustains you is muffled, as if it struggles to remain viable against the dark energy that imbues your soul. At your option, you can pick from or roll on the following table to create a unique quirk for your character.

entries.caption: Shadow Sorcerer Quirks
rows: You are always icy cold to the touch.
When you are asleep, you don't appear to breathe (though you must still breathe to survive).
You don't seem to bleed, even when badly injured.
Your heart beats once per minute. This even sometimes surprises you.
You have trouble remembering that living creatures and corpses should be treated differently.
You blinked. Once. Last week.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Dark
entries: From 1st level, you have {@sense 黑暗视觉} with a range of 60 feet. You can cast {@spell 黑暗术} by spending 1 sorcery point. You can see through any {@spell 黑暗术} spell you cast using this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of the Grave
entries: Starting at 1st level, your existence in a twilight state between life and death makes you difficult to defeat. Whenever damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 + the damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. You cannot use this feature if you are reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage or by a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Hound of Ill Omen
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to call forth a howling creature of darkness to harass your foes. As a bonus action, you can spend 3 sorcery points to summon a hound of ill omen to target one creature you can see. The hound uses a dire wolf's statistics with the following changes:

items: The hound is size Medium.
It can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The hound takes 5 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
At the start of its turn, the hound automatically knows its target's location. If the target was hidden, it is no longer hidden from the hound.

entries: The hound appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of the target. Roll initiative for the hound. On its turn, it can move only towards its target by the most direct route, and it can use its action only to attack its target. The hound makes opportunity attack, but only against its target. Additionally, the target has disadvantage on all saving throws against your spells while the hound is within 5 feet of it. The hound disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points, if its target is reduced to 0 hit points, or after 5 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Walk
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action, you can teleport up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Form
entries: At 18th level, you can spend 3 sorcery points to transform yourself into a shadow form as a bonus action. In this form, you have resistance to all damage except force damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 force damage if you end your turn inside an object. You remain in this form for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Favored Soul
entries: You have been chosen by a deity, and bestowed with a fragment of their divine power. You have been fundamentally changed by the touch of this deity, which awakens powerful magical abilities inside you.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency in light armor, medium armor, shields, and simple weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Chosen of the Gods
entries: At 1st level, you choose one of the cleric class's divine domains. You add that domain's spells for 1st-level clerics to your known spells. These spells do not count against the number of spells you can know, and they are considered to be sorcerer spells for you. When you reach 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th levels in the sorcerer class, you likewise learn your domain's spells that become available at those levels.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action 攻击} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Wings
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to sprout a pair of wings from your back (feathered or bat-like, your choice), gaining a flying speed equal to your current walking speed. You can create these wings as a bonus action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn.
You can't manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

subclassFeature.name: Power of the Chosen
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you cast one of the spells you learned from your Chosen of the Gods class feature, you regain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) + the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Favored Soul v3
entries: Sometimes the spark of magic that fuels a sorcerer comes from a divine source that glimmers within the soul. Having such a favored soul, your innate magic might come from a distant but powerful familial connection to a divine being. Perhaps your ancestor was an angel, transformed into a mortal and sent to fight in a god's name. Or your birth might align with an ancient prophecy, marking you as a servant of the gods or a chosen vessel of divine magic.

Favored souls, with their natural magnetism and strong personalities, are often seen as threats by traditional religious hierarchies. As outsiders who command the power of the gods, these sorcerers can undermine the existing order and claim a direct tie to the divine.

In some cultures, only those who can claim the power of a favored soul may command religious power. In these lands, ecclesiastical positions are dominated by a few bloodlines and preserved over generations.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Magic
entries: Your link to the divine allows you to learn spells normally associated with the cleric class. When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn a sorcerer cantrip or a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose the new spell from the cleric spell list, in addition to the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.
You also learn the {@spell 治疗伤势} spell, which does not count against your number of sorcerer spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Favored by the Gods
entries: Starting at 1st level, divine power guards your destiny. If you fail a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Healing
entries: Starting at 6th level, the celestial energy coursing through you can empower your healing magic. Whenever you roll dice to determine the number of hit points a sorcerer spell of yours restores, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll any number of those dice once.

subclassFeature.name: Angelic Form
entries: At 14th level, your divine essence causes you to undergo a minor physical transformation. Your appearance takes on an otherworldly version of one of the following qualities (your choice): beautiful, youthful, kind, or imposing.

In addition, as a bonus action, you can manifest a pair of spectral wings from your back. The wings last until you're {@condition 无力} or you dismiss them as a bonus action. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Unearthly Recovery
entries: At 18th level, you gain the ability to overcome grievous injuries. As a bonus action when you have less than half of your hit points remaining, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Whatever your choice, if your proficiency bonus applies to a Charisma check, double that bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Unearthly Recovery
entries: At 18th level, you gain the ability to overcome grievous injuries. As a bonus action when you have less than half of your hit points remaining, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Phoenix Sorcery (UA)
entries: Your power draws from the immortal flame that fuels the legendary phoenix. You or your ancestors perhaps rendered a phoenix a great service, or you were born in its presence. Whatever the cause, a shard of the phoenix's power dwells within you.

That power is a mixed blessing. Like the mythical creature, you can invoke fiery energy and gain the ability to cheat death itself. This power comes at a cost. The fire within you seethes, demanding to be unleashed. You sometimes find yourself absentmindedly feeding fires. You can't bear to allow a fire to sputter out. You feel most comfortable while holding a lit torch or sitting in front of a campfire.

More importantly, this gift comes with no special protection from fire. You are as vulnerable as any other creature to fiery magic, including your own. Phoenix sorcerers can use their powers to pull themselves back from the brink of death, and all too often their own, rash nature or reliance on destructive magic is what puts them there in the first place.

Such sorcerers are wanderers by necessity. The volatile nature of their magic makes other folk nervous. If a fire breaks out in town, a phoenix sorcerer had best flee, whether guilty or not. Fire is a dangerous force, and phoenix sorcerers have a reputation (deserved or not) for reckless behavior, confident that the essence of the phoenix can save them.

entries.caption: Phoenix Soul Quirks
rows: You absentmindedly ignite small fires that quickly sputter out.
You cackle like a fiend when you unleash your fire spells.
You admire fire, even if it burns your friends.
You are covered in burns that mark the first time your power manifested.
You like your food charred.
You are brave to the point of recklessness.

subclassFeature.name: Ignite
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to start fires with a touch. As an action, you can magically ignite a flammable object you touch with your hand—an object such as a torch, a piece of tinder, or the hem of drapes.

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Flame
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash the phoenix fire that blazes within you.
As a bonus action, you magically wreathe yourself in swirling fire, as your eyes glow like hot coals. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
Any creature takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier if it hits you with a melee attack from within 5 feet of you or if it touches you.
Whenever you roll fire damage on your turn, the roll gains a bonus to equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Phoenix Spark
entries: Starting at 6th level, the fiery energy within you grows restless and vengeful. In the face of defeat, it surges outward to preserve you in a fiery roar.

If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to draw on the spark of the phoenix. You are instead reduced to 1 hit point, and each creature within 10 feet of you takes fire damage equal to half your sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier.

If you use this feature while under the effects of your Mantle of Flame, this feature instead deals fire damage equal to your sorcerer level + double your Charisma modifier, and your Mantle of Flame immediately ends.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Nourishing Fire
entries: Starting at 14th level, your fire spells soothe and restore you. When you expend a spell slot to cast a spell that includes a fire damage roll, you regain hit points equal to the slot's level + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Form of the Phoenix
entries: At 18th level, you finally master the spark of fire that dances within you. While under the effect of your Mantle of Flame feature, you gain additional benefits:

items: You have a flying speed of 40 feet and can hover.
You have resistance to all damage.
If you use your Phoenix Spark, that feature deals an extra 20 fire damage to each creature.

subclassFeature.name: Sea Sorcery (UA)
entries: The power of water is the strength of flexibility, resilience, and a relentless nature. Water parts to allow a ship to sail over it or a diver to plunge into it, but their passing leaves no mark. Water flowing down a mountain reaches the sea. It might bend and turn across valleys and down hillsides, but it slowly and steadily returns to the waves. Those whose souls are touched by the power of elemental water command a similar power.

Your heritage ties to powerful creatures of the sea, such as nereids, the lords of the merfolk, and elemental powers. Like a river, you feel the call of the ocean. The call is ever present in your heart, and you are never completely at peace until you are near the sea.

subclassFeature.name: Curse of the Sea
entries: When you choose this origin at 1st level, you learn the secret of infusing your spells with a watery curse.

When you hit a creature with a cantrip's attack or when a creature fails a saving throw against your cantrip, you can curse the target until the end of your next turn or until you curse a different creature with this feature.

Once per turn when you cast a spell, you can trigger the curse if that spell deals cold or lightning damage to the cursed target or forces it to move. Doing so subjects the target to the appropriate additional effect below, and then the curse ends if the spell isn't a cantrip (you choose the effect to use if more than one effect applies):

entries.name: Cold damage
entries: If the affected target takes cold damage from your spell, the target's speed is also reduced by 15 feet until the end of your next turn. If the spell already reduces the target's speed, use whichever reduction is greater.

entries.name: Lightning Damage
entries: If the affected target takes lightning damage from your spell, the target takes additional lightning damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Forced Movement
entries: If the target is moved by your spell, increase the distance it is moved by 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of the Sea
entries: At 1st level, your tie to the sea grants you the ability to breathe underwater, and you have a swim speed equal to your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Watery Defense
entries: At 6th level, you gain resistance to fire damage.

You also gain the ability to defend yourself by momentarily assuming a watery form. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack and take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from it, you can reduce that damage by an amount equal to your sorcerer level plus your Charisma score, and then you can move up to 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. Once you use this special reaction, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shifting Form
entries: Starting at 14th level, you gain the ability to enter a liquid state while moving.
When you move on your turn, you take only half damage from opportunity attacks, and you can move through any enemy's space but can't willingly end your move there.

On your turn, you can move through any space that is at least 3 inches in diameter and do so without squeezing. When you stop moving, the regular squeezing rules apply if you're in a space one size smaller than you. You can't willingly stop in a space smaller than that, and if you're forced to do so, you immediately flow to the nearest space that can fit you, back along the path of your movement.

subclassFeature.name: Water Soul
entries: Starting at 18th level, your being is altered by the power of the sea. You gain the following benefits:

items: You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep.
A critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Stone Sorcery (UA)
entries: Your magic springs from a mystical link between your soul and the magic of elemental earth. You might trace a distant ancestor to the Plane of Earth, or your family might have earned a mighty boon in return for a service to the dao lords. Whatever your past, the magic of elemental earth is yours to command.

Your link to earth magic grants you extraordinary resilience, and stone sorcerers have a natural affinity for combat. A steel blade feels like a natural extension of your body, and sorcerers with this origin have a knack for wielding both shields and weapons. In combat your place is amid the fray. You rely on your elemental nature to shield you from harm and your magic and metal weapons to overwhelm your foes.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Stone's Durability
entries: At 1st level, your connection to stone gives you extra fortitude. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

As an action, you can gain a base AC of 13 + your Constitution modifier if you aren't wearing armor, and your skin assumes a stony appearance. This effect lasts until you end it as a bonus action, you are {@condition 无力}, or you don armor other than a shield.

subclassFeature.name: Stone: Metal Magic
entries: Your affinity for metal gives you the option to learn some non-sorcerer spells that focus on weapon attacks. When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can select the spell from the following list of spells, in addition to the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.

entries.caption: Metal Magic
rows: 1st
{@spell 强迫决斗}, {@spell 炽炎斩}, {@spell 雷霆斩}, {@spell 激愤斩}
2nd
{@spell 烙印斩}, {@spell 魔化武器}
3rd
{@spell 致盲斩}, {@spell 元素武器}
4th
{@spell 惊震斩}

subclassFeature.name: Stone Aegis
entries: Starting at 6th level, your command of earth magic grows stronger, allowing you to harness it for your allies' protection.

As a bonus action, you can grant an aegis to one allied creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The aegis is a dim, gray aura of earth magic that protects the target. Any bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage the target takes is reduced by 2 + your sorcerer level divided by 4. This effect lasts for 1 minute, until you use it again, or until you are {@condition 无力}.

In addition, when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you hits the protected target with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the attacker. You can teleport only if you and the attacker are on the same surface. You can then make one melee weapon attack against the attacker. If that attack hits, it deals an extra {@damage 1d10} force damage. This extra damage increases to {@dice 2d10} at 11th level and {@dice 3d10} at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Stone's Edge
entries: Starting at 14th level, your mastery of earth magic allows you to add the force of elemental earth to your spells. When you cast a spell that deals damage, choose one creature damaged by that spell on the round you cast it. That creature takes extra force damage equal to half your sorcerer level. This feature can be used only once per casting of a spell.

subclassFeature.name: Earth Master's Aegis
entries: Beginning at 18th level, when you use your Stone Aegis to protect an ally, you can choose up to three creatures to gain its benefits.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Mind
entries: An alien influence has wrapped its tendrils around you, warping you in both body and mind. Perhaps a psychic splinter lodged in your psyche after you suffered domination by an aboleth. Maybe you were born somewhere tainted by the Far Realm, a planar blot that changed you forever. Or perhaps mind flayers kidnapped you, subjecting you to the nightmarish process of ceremorphosis—but the transformation failed and left you altered.

subclassFeature.name: Invasive Thoughts
entries: {@i 1st-level Aberrant Mind feature}

At 1st level, you gain the ability to use a bonus action to magically create a telepathic link with one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the link ends, you can telepathically speak to the target through the link, and if it understands at least one language, it can speak telepathically to you. The link lasts for 10 minutes, and it ends early if you are {@condition 无力} or die, or if you use another bonus action to break the link or to establish this link with a different creature.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Aberrant Mind feature}

Starting at 1st level, your aberrant nature changes your mind in subtle but profound ways. You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Psionic Spells table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Psionic Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell 哈达之臂}, {@spell 噪音暗语}
3rd
{@spell 安定心神}, {@spell 侦测思想}
5th
{@spell 哈达之欲}, {@spell 短讯术}
7th
{@spell 强迫术}, {@spell 艾伐黑触手}
9th
{@spell 修改记忆}, {@spell 拉瑞心灵联结}

subclassFeature.name: Unique Disturbance
entries: Regardless of its genesis, the Aberrant Mind origin imparts a sense of eeriness to the character or their surroundings. This can be as subtle as when your sorcerer reads a creature's mind with detect thoughts, anyone in their immediate vicinity experiences a faint but pervasive sense of dread. Or it could be unmistakable, such as sweating a sheen of viscous mucus when you're scared, or your pupils squirming when you're excited. Consider the potentially unspeakable source of your sorcerer's powers, and use that as a guide to weave threads of eeriness throughout your magic.

subclassFeature.name: Warped Being
entries: {@i 1st-level Aberrant Mind feature}

Starting at 1st level, your aberrant origin protects you from harm. Your body might have a coating of viscous slime, tough hide, scales, or an invisible psionic barrier (choose the form of protection when you gain this feature). Whatever form the protection takes, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier while you aren't wearing armor.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Sorcery
entries: {@i 6th-level Aberrant Mind feature}

Beginning at 6th level, when you cast any of the spells gained from your Psionic Spells feature, you can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level. If you cast the spell using sorcery points, it requires no components.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Defenses
entries: {@i 6th-level Aberrant Mind feature}
At 6th level, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition 魅惑} or {@condition 恐惧}.

subclassFeature.name: Revelation in Flesh
entries: {@i 14th-level Aberrant Mind feature}

Beginning at 14th level, you can unleash the aberrant truth hidden within your flesh. As a bonus action, you can spend 1 or more sorcery points to magically transform your body for 1 minute. For each sorcery point you spend, you can gain one of the following benefits of your choice, the effects of which last until the transformation ends:

items: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and the ability to breathe water. Gills grow from your neck or fan out from behind your ears, your fingers become webbed, or you grow lashing cilia that extend through your clothing.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. As you fly, your skin glistens with mucus.

Your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, becomes slimy and pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition 被擒}.
Your eyes turn black or become writhing sensory tendrils. You are aware of the location of any hidden or {@condition 隐形} creature within 60 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Warp Reality
entries: {@i 18th-level Aberrant Mind feature}

At 18th level, you become the focal point of a reality-warping anomaly. As an action, you can magically radiate a transparent, 20-foot-radius aura for 1 minute. This might take the form of a sphere of rippling psychic energy, a fluctuating amoebic gel, an extrusion of ephemeral parasites, or some other manifestation. Other creatures treat the aura as difficult terrain, and when they start their turn in it, they take {@damage 2d10} psychic damage. When you activate this feature, you can choose any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by the aura.

As a bonus action, you can end the aura early. If you do so, you and any number of creatures you choose within the aura are teleported to a location you can see within 1 mile of you. Each creature must appear within 20 feet of you and in an unoccupied space. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC is not teleported. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Sorcery
entries: Your innate magic comes from the power of elemental air. Perhaps you were born during a howling gale so powerful that folk still tell stories of it. Your lineage might include the influence of potent air creatures such as vaati or djinni. Whatever the case, the magic of the storm permeates your soul.

Storm sorcerers are invaluable members of a ship's crew. Their magic allows them to exert control over wind and weather in their immediate area. Their abilities also prove useful in repelling attacks by sahuagin, pirates, and other waterborne threats.

subclassFeature.name: Stormborn
entries: The arcane magic you command is infused with elemental air. You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial}. In addition, you gain the following spells at the listed sorcerer level. These spells do not count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Storm Sorcerer Bonus Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell 云雾术}, {@spell 雷鸣波}
3rd
{@spell 造风术}, {@spell 浮空术}
5th
{@spell 召雷术}, {@spell 雪雨暴}
7th
{@spell 召唤次级元素生物}*, {@spell 冰风暴}
9th
{@spell 召唤元素生物}**
footnotes: * Unless you gain this spell from another source, you can summon only {@creature smoke mephit||smoke mephits}, {@creature steam mephit||steam mephits}, {@creature ice mephit||ice mephits}, or {@creature dust mephit||dust mephits} with it.
**Unless you gain this spell from another source, you can summon only {@creature air elemental||air elementals} with it.

subclassFeature.name: Tempestuous Magic
entries: At 1st level, you are attuned to elemental air magic. Whenever you cast a spell other than a cantrip during your turn, whirling gusts of elemental air surround you. You can use a bonus action to fly 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: At 6th level, you gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage. Whenever you cast a spell other than a cantrip that deals lightning or thunder damage, a stormy aura surrounds you. In addition to the spell's effects, creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you take lightning or thunder damage (choose each time this ability activates) equal to half your sorcerer level.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Guide
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to subtly control the weather around you.
If it is raining, you can use an action to cause the rain to stop falling in a 20‐foot radius centered on you. You can end this effect as a bonus action.

If it is windy, you can use a bonus action each round to choose the direction that the wind blows in a 100‐foot radius around you. The wind blows in that direction until the end of your next turn. You have no ability to alter the speed of the wind.

subclassFeature.name: Storm's Fury
entries: At 14th level, the storm energy you channel through your magic seethes within your soul. When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal lightning damage to the attacker equal to your sorcerer level. The attacker must also make a Strength saving throw, with a DC equal to 8 + your Charisma bonus + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line 20 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Wind Soul
entries: At 18th level, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet and immunity to lightning and thunder damage. As an action, you can reduce your flying speed to 30 feet for one hour and choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. The chosen creatures gain a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: 神圣之魂
entries: 有时候充斥于术士体内的魔力火花是来自于一种闪耀于灵魂中神性泉源。拥有着这种祝福灵魂，代表你的天生魔法可能来自一个与某种神性存在有所联系，遥远而强大家族。也许你的祖先曾是一名天使，变成了凡人并奉神之名被遣来战斗。
或者，你的出生可能符合了一个古老的预言，表明你作为诸神的仆从或神圣魔法的器皿。
一个具有天生魅力的神圣之魂术士，会被某些宗教派系视为威胁。作为一个能行使神圣力量的局外人，一个神圣之魂术士可以通过声称与神之间的直接联系来颠覆现有的秩序。
在某些文化中，只有那些拥有神圣之魂力量的人们才能统御宗教势力。在这些国度，教会的地位仅由少数血脉给支配，代代相传。

subclassFeature.name: 神圣魔法
entries: {@i 1级神圣之魂特性}
你与神性之间的联系让你得以学习来自牧师职业的法术。当你的施法特性让你学习或取代一个术士戏法、或一个1环或更高环的术士法术时，你可以从牧师法术列表或术士法术列表中选择新的法术。你仍然必须遵从选择法术的所有其它限制，且它对你而言视作术士法术。
此外，为你神圣能量的源头选择一种倾向：善良、邪恶、守序、混乱、中立。你基于该倾向学习一个额外的法术，如下表所示。它对你而言视作术士法术，但并不会计入你已知术士法术的数量中。若你之后想取代该法术，则你必须以一个来自牧师法术列表的法术取代它。

rows: 善良
{@spell 治疗伤势}
邪恶
{@spell 造成伤势}
守序
{@spell 祝福术}
混乱
{@spell 灾祸术}
中立
{@spell 防护善恶}

subclassFeature.name: 诸神眷顾
entries: {@i 1级神圣之魂特性}
神圣能量守护着你的命运。若你在一次豁免检定中失败、或在一次攻击检定中失手，你可以骰{@dice 2d4}并将其掷骰结果加入检定的总和中，并可能因此改变检定结果。一旦你使用此能力，你直到完成一次短休或长休前都不能再使用它。

subclassFeature.name: 强效治疗
entries: {@i 6级神圣之魂特性}
奔驰于你体内的神圣能量可以强化治疗法术。每当你或一个距离你5尺内的盟友掷骰决定一个法术所回复的生命值数值时，只要你并非处于{@condition 无力}状态，你就可以消耗1点术法点以重骰任意数量的这些骰子一次。你每个回合只能使用此能力一次。

subclassFeature.name: 超凡之翼
entries: {@i 14级神圣之魂特性}
你可以使用一个附赠动作以从你背后展现出一对灵体翅膀。当这对翅膀存在时，你拥有30尺的飞行速度。这对翅膀会持续存在直到你陷入{@condition 无力}状态、死亡、或你以一个附赠动作解消它们。
你为你神圣魔法能力所选择的倾向，将会决定这对灵体翅膀的外观：善良或守序则为鹰翼、邪恶或混乱则为蝙蝠翅膀、中立则为蜻蜓翅膀。

subclassFeature.name: 神秘痊愈
entries: {@i 18级神圣之魂特性}
你获得克服严重伤势的能力。当你只剩下少于一半的生命值时，以一个附赠动作，你可以回复等同于你生命值最大值一半的生命值。
一旦你使用此能力，直到你完成一次长休前都不能再使用它。

subclassFeature.name: 幽影魔法
entries: 身为影之造物，你的天生魔法来自堕影冥界本身。或许你能追溯你的家系到一个来自该处的存在，又或者你曾暴露于堕影冥界的可怕能量之下并被其转化。
幽影魔法的力量在你的身体表征上蒙上了一层怪异的帷幕。维持着你的生命火花因压抑而模糊，仿佛它在与深入你灵魂的黑暗能量对抗而挣扎生存。根据你的选择，你可以从幽影术士怪异特征表中为你的角色挑选或掷骰决定一个怪异特征。

entries.caption: 幽影术士怪异特征
rows: 你摸起来永远如冰般寒冷。
当你熟睡时，你像是没有在呼吸（但你仍需要呼吸以维生）。
你鲜少流血，即使受到重伤也一样。
你的心跳每一分钟才脉动一下。这件事有时候也会让你惊讶。
你难以记住活着的生物和尸体应该被差别待遇。
你上周，眨眼，只眨了一次。

subclassFeature.name: 幽暗之瞳
entries: {@i 1级幽影魔法特性}
你具有120尺范围的{@sense 黑暗视觉}。
当你在本职业升至3级时，你习得{@spell 黑暗术}法术，且它不会计入你的已知术士法术数量中。此外，你可以借由消耗2点术法点或一个法术位来施放它。若你通过术法点施放它，你可以看透由此法术创造出来的黑暗。

subclassFeature.name: 终焉之力
entries: {@i 1级幽影魔法特性}
你处于生与死之间模糊状态的存在使你难以被击败。当伤害将你的生命值归零时，你可以进行一次魅力豁免（DC 5 + 所受到的伤害）。若豁免成功，你改为将你的生命值减少至1。若你是因为光耀伤害或暴击而导致生命值归零，则你不能使用此能力。
在该豁免检定成功后，你直到完成一次长休之前都不能再使用此能力。

subclassFeature.name: 凶兆猎犬
entries: {@i 6级幽影魔法特性}
你获得呼唤出一个咆啸着的黑暗生物以侵扰你敌人的能力。以一个附赠动作，你可以消耗3点术法点以用魔法召唤出一个凶兆猎犬，并指定一个距离你120尺内且你所能看见的生物作为目标。这个猎犬使用{@creature 恐狼}的数据（参见《怪物图鉴》或《玩家手册》的附录C），但有以下的改变：

items: 猎犬的体型为中型，而非大型；且它被视作怪兽，而非野兽。
它在出现时拥有等同于你术士等级一半的临时生命值。
它可以如同穿过困难地形一样移动穿过其他生物和物体。若猎犬在一个物体内结束它的回合，猎犬将受到5点力场伤害。
在它的回合开始时，猎犬将自动知晓它目标的所在位置。若该目标在躲藏中，则它对猎犬而言不再视为躲藏中。

entries: 猎犬会出现在距离目标30尺内你所选择的一处未被占据空间。为猎犬骰先攻。在它的回合，它只能通过最直接的路径移向它的目标，且它只能使用它的动作以攻击它的目标。猎犬可以进行借机攻击，但只能以它的目标为攻击对象。此外，当猎犬距离目标5尺内，目标在对抗你所施放的任何法术的豁免检定中具有劣势。猎犬会在它的生命值归零、它目标的生命值归零、或者5分钟之后消失。

subclassFeature.name: 幽影漫步
entries: {@i 14级幽影魔法特性}
你获得从阴影间穿梭的能力。当你处于微光光照或黑暗环境中，以一个附赠动作，你可以用魔法传送最多120尺距离到一处你所能看见，且同样处于微光光照或黑暗环境中的未被占据空间。

subclassFeature.name: 暗影型态
entries: {@i 18级幽影魔法特性}
你可以消耗6点术法点并以一个附赠动作魔法地将自己转变为幽影型态。当处于此型态，你对除了力场和光耀伤害以外的所有伤害具有抗性，且你可以如同穿过困难地形一样移动穿过其他生物和物体。若你在一个物体内结束它的回合，你将受到5点力场伤害。
你能维持此型态长达1分钟。它会在你陷入{@condition 无力}状态、你死亡、或你以一个附赠动作解消它时提早结束。

subclassFeature.name: 暴风术法
entries: 你的天生魔法来自于气元素的力量。许多拥有这种力量的人可以追溯其魔法到一次暴雨导致的濒死经验、或可能你在一阵狂风呼啸中诞生，而那狂风是如此强大以至于人们至今仍传诵着它的故事，又或者，你的家系可能受到了像是气巨灵之类的气元素生物影响。无论是哪种情况，暴风魔法都已充斥于你体内。
暴风术士在船队中是无价的成员。他们的魔法让他们得以驾驭周遭区域风和气象。他们的能力也被证明在对抗沙华鱼人、海盗、或其他水生威胁时相当有效。

subclassFeature.name: 风暴魔法
entries: {@i 1级暴风术法特性}
紧接在你施放一个1环或更高环的法术之前或之后，你可以在你的回合使用一个附赠动作以使元素之气形成的旋转阵风短暂地环绕着你。这么做让你得以飞行最多10尺距离，而不会引发借机攻击。

subclassFeature.name: 风语者
entries: {@i 1级暴风术法特性}
你所支配的奥法魔力充盈着气之元素。你可以说、读、写{@language Primordial}。知晓这个语言让你得以理解使用其同源语系的生物，并让它们理解你所说的话。其同源语系为：{@language Aquan}, {@language Auran}, {@language Ignan} 和 {@language Terran}。

subclassFeature.name: 暴风之心
entries: {@i 6级暴风术法特性}
你获得对闪电和雷鸣伤害的抗性。此外，每当你开始施放一个1环或更高环，且会造成闪电或雷鸣伤害的法术时，暴风魔法将从你身上迸发而出。这阵迸发会使距离你10尺内你所选且你能看见的所有生物受到等同于你术士等级一半的闪电或雷鸣伤害（每次此能力发动时选择）。

subclassFeature.name: 暴风导向
entries: {@i 6级暴风术法特性}
你获得巧妙控制你周遭天气的能力。
若正在下雨，你可以使用一个动作，让以你为中心20尺半径球体内的空间停止降雨。你能够以一个附赠动作中止这个效果。
若正在刮风，你可以在每轮以一个附赠动作选择以你为中心100尺半径球体内的阵风吹向你所选的方向。这阵风会向着该方向吹拂直到你的下个回合结束。此能力并不会改变风速。

subclassFeature.name: 暴风狂怒
entries: {@i 14级暴风术法特性}
当你被一次近战攻击命中时，你可以使用你的反应以对攻击者造成闪电伤害。此伤害等同于你的术士等级。攻击者同时必须进行一次对抗你术士法术豁免DC的力量豁免。若豁免失败，攻击者将被直线推离你最远20尺的距离。

subclassFeature.name: 清风之魂
entries: {@i 18级暴风术法特性}
你获得对闪电和雷鸣伤害的免疫。
你也获得魔法性的60尺飞行速度。以一个动作，你可以降低你的飞行速度至30尺，持续1小时，并选择数量最多等同于3 + 你魅力调整值的生物。所选生物将获得魔法性的30尺飞行速度，持续1小时。一旦你通过这个方式降低你的飞行速度，你直到完成一次短休或长休之前都不能再这么做。
